LeidenUniv.Tools

Class Special_Threshold

  • java.lang.Object
    • LeidenUniv.Tools.Special_Threshold
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ij.gui.DialogListener, ij.plugin.PlugIn, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Special_Threshold
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.PlugIn, ij.gui.DialogListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Author:
    willemsejj This plugin is created by Joost Willemse @ leiden University It can be used to threshold images on other factors than just intensity It basically applies a filter to the image and allows you to set the threshold on that filtered image without needing to see the intermediate

      • run

      • getMask

        public ij.ImagePlus getMask(ij.ImagePlus im,
                            int ks,
                            int Ltresh,
                            int Thresh,
                            int Method)
        Parameters:
        im, - the imageplus that needs to be masked
        ks, - kernel size (radius)
        Ltresh, - lower threshold level to use
        Thresh, - top threshold level to use
        Method - The method used for filtering This is the part of the plugin that can be called from another plugin It returns a binary image that can be used for further processing
        Returns:
        The masked image

      • getThreshold

        public void getThreshold(int Tval,
                         int Cval,
                         int Bval,
                         boolean recalc)
        Parameters:
        Tval - Current threshold setting
        Cval - Current method for thresholding
        Bval - current lower threshold setting
        recalc - recalculate or not This method gets the threshold

      • getFFTKurt

        public double getFFTKurt(int xm,
                         int ym,
                         int xw,
                         int yw,
                         ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Parameters:
        xm - middle x pixel
        ym - middle y pixel
        xw - width over x
        yw - height over y
        ip - imageprocessor to calculte this on
        Returns:
        the new double value that goes into the overlay image
